Introduction.Japanese: 大和型戦艦一番艦大和、対空火器を大幅に強化致しました。
Introduction.English: First of the Yamato-class battleships, Yamato. Now with much upgraded anti-air weaponry.
Introduction.Note: After being damaged by American submarine, Yamato returned to Kure for extensive repairs. Two secondary guns were removed and replaced with anti-aircraft flak guns and Radar.

Library.Japanese: 大和型戦艦一番艦、大和です。艦隊決戦の切り札として、呉海軍工廠で極秘建造されました。当時の最高技術の粋を結集されたこの体、二番艦の武蔵とともに、連合艦隊の中枢戦力として頑張ります！
Library.English: First of the Yamato-class battleships, Yamato. As the trump card for the Decisive Battle, I was made in utmost secrecy at the Kure Naval Yard. With the most up-to-date and sophisticated technology concentrated in my body, along with the 2nd ship, Musashi, I will do my best as the centre of the combined fleet!
Library.Note: Decisive Naval Battle, or Kantai Kessen, was the IJN's strategic doctrine during WWII, in which after a series of operations had weakened the US fleet, battleships would finish the last, and presumably, the strongest part of the fleet.

Secretary 1.Japanese: 提督～？ あの～、いえ、いいですけど…
Secretary 1.English: Admiral~? Erm~ no, its okay, but...

Secretary 2.Japanese: んもぉ～、ホテルなんて言わせませんよ！

Secretary 3.Japanese: 提督？ あの、まあ…居住性は他の娘とは段違いではあるのだけれど…いいの？
Secretary 3.English: Admiral? Um... well, my living conditions are noticeably different than the other girls'. ...Is that okay?
Secretary 3.Note: Air conditioned quarters, bathhouse, kitchen with refrigeration facility. full course meal for officers with live band playing in the background. Most of these considered highly luxurious for combat vessels of its time.

Idle.Japanese: ん…あ…提督ごめんなさい。主砲ちょっと邪魔ですか？
Idle.English: Mm... ah... I'm sorry, admiral. Are my main guns in your way?
Idle.Note: Yamato's main cannons are the largest naval guns in the world.

Secretary Married.Japanese: 提督、少しお疲れではないですか？大和が特製紅茶、お入れしましょうか。気持ちが休まりますよ。ちょっと、待っていて下さいね。
Secretary Married.English: Admiral, are you feeling a bit tired? Shall I make some special tea for you? It will help you feel relaxed. Ufu♪ Please wait a little while.

Wedding.Japanese: 提督、いつもありがとうございます。連合艦隊の旗艦を務めるよりも、敵戦艦と撃ちあうよりも、今、こうしている時が私は一番好き。大和は…ずっと提督の、あなたの側で、頑張ります。
Wedding.English: Admiral, as always, thank you so much. Even more than serving as flagship of the Combined Fleet... and more than fighting enemy battleships... it's now... this moment... that I love the most. I will... always, Admiral... at my darling's side, I shall do my best.

Looking At Scores.Japanese: 我が艦隊の戦績ですか？楽しみです。
Looking At Scores.English: Our fleet's military records? Looking forward to it.

Equipment 1.Japanese: 改装ですね？ありがたいです！
Equipment 1.English: A remodel, then? Thank you so much!

Equipment 2.Japanese: あ、ありがとうございます！

Equipment 3.Note: ⇧ shared with expedition selection, resource collection, instant repair and development

Supply.English: I am grateful for your assistance.
Supply.Note: She often speaks in very polite/honorific form.

Docking Minor.Japanese: 短めのお風呂、いただきます。
Docking Minor.English: I shall take a short bath.

Docking Major.Japanese: あ、甘く見た訳じゃないんだけど、ごめんなさい。
Docking Major.English: I...I didn't underestimate (the enemy), though I'm sorry.

Docking Complete.Japanese: 修理完了の艦娘が在るみたいです。
Docking Complete.English: Repairing of the ship daughter seems to be completed.

Construction.Japanese: 新しい艦娘（かんむす）が戦列に加わりました。
Construction.English: New ship girls has been added to our lineup.

Returning From Sortie.Japanese: 艦隊が無事帰投しました。良かったぁ～！
Returning From Sortie.English: Our fleet has returned safely. That's great~!

Starting A Sortie.Japanese: 戦艦大和、推して参ります。

Battle Start.Japanese: 大和、砲雷撃戦、はじめます！

Attack.Japanese: 敵艦捕捉、全主砲薙ぎ払え！
Attack.Note: ⇧ shared with day/night special attacks, support expedition team arrival

Night Attack.Japanese: そうか･･･それなら･･･やるしかないわね！
Night Attack.English: Is that so... well then, I have to do this!

MVP.Japanese: 大和が一番ですか。少し晴れがましいですね。次の海戦もお任せ下さいね。
MVP.English: I'm number one? I'm a bit proud of myself. Leave the next sortie to me!

Minor Damage 1.Japanese: そ、それで直撃のつもりなの！？
Minor Damage 1.English: D-did you think you landed a direct hit?

Minor Damage 2.Japanese: 傾斜復元しないと…。注水を急いで！
Minor Damage 2.English: I'm starting to list... ballast pumps, hurry!

Major Damage.Japanese: くっ、こんな所で、大和は、沈みません！
Major Damage.English: Hmph, Yamato, will not, sink at such place!
Major Damage.Note: She was listing two or three times during Operation Ten-Go

Sunk.Japanese: また…逝くのね…総員…最上甲板…武蔵…信濃…あとは頼みます…
Sunk.English: Again... I pass away... all hands... top deck... Musashi... Shinano... I leave the rest to you...
Sunk.Note: Yamato was ultimately destroyed by a magazine explosion, unleashing a mushroom cloud more than 3.7 miles high that could be seen almost a hundred miles away on Kyushu. Note that historically both Musashi and Shinano were sunk earlier than Yamato.

00:00.Japanese: マルマルマルマル。深夜ですね。

01:00.Japanese: マルヒトマルマル。提督、そろそろお休みにならないと。
01:00.English: 0100. Admiral, shouldn't you be going to bed soon?

02:00.Japanese: 提督？まだ寝なくて大丈夫ですか？現在時刻マルフタマルマルです。
02:00.English: Admiral? Not going to bed, are you okay? It is now 0200.

03:00.Japanese: マルサンマルマル。そろそろ流石にお疲れじゃないですか？
03:00.English: 0300. At this time, certainly shouldn't you be tired?

04:00.Japanese: 現在時刻マルヨンマルマルです。提督、そろそろ朝になっちゃいます。
04:00.English: It is now 0400. Admiral, it will soon be morning.

05:00.Japanese: 提督、マルゴーマルマルです。空が白み始めてきちゃいましたね。
05:00.English: Admiral, 0500. The sky is becoming white now.

06:00.Japanese: 朝です。マルロクマルマル。提督、朝は本当に御早いですね。
06:00.English: It's Morning. 0600. Admiral, the morning really came quickly, didn't it?

07:00.Japanese: マルナナマルマル、朝食の時間。大和ホテル自慢のコンソメ御飲みになります？
07:00.English: 0700, Breakfast time. How about some of Hotel Yamato's famous consomme?
07:00.Note: The Yamato was used as a meeting place for high-level officers, so she had a very good mess; so good that Yamamoto gained weight from living on the Yamato.

08:00.Japanese: 現在時刻マルハチマルマルです。連合艦隊旗艦としてそろそろ動きますね。
08:00.English: It is now 0800. The combined fleet will be moving soon.

09:00.Japanese: マルキュウマルマルです。提督、今日の作戦行動はどうされますか？
09:00.English: 0900. Admiral, how is today's battle mobilization going?

10:00.Japanese: 提督、他の艦隊の運用はどうされます？時刻は今、ヒトマルマルマルです。
10:00.English: Admiral, how are the other fleets? It is currently 1000.

11:00.Japanese: ヒトヒトマルマル。そろそろ昼食の準備をしないと…。何がいいですか？
11:00.English: 1100. I have to start preparing for lunch soon... What would be good?

12:00.Japanese: ヒトフタマルマル ランチタイムに大和ホテル自慢の…あぁ…ホテルじゃないです
12:00.English: 1200. Hotel Yamato's famous lunch time's... wait, I'm not a hotel.

13:00.Japanese: ヒトサンマルマル、です。食後は少し眠くなりますね。
13:00.English: It's 1300. You get a bit tired after eating, yes?

14:00.Japanese: ヒトヨンマルマルです。ふぁ～…はっ！あ、寝てませんよ！？

15:00.Japanese: ヒトゴーマルマル。提督、ラムネでも飲まれますか？
15:00.English: 1500. Admiral, will you have a Ramune?

16:00.Japanese: ヒトロクマルマル。そろそろ夕暮れ時ですね。

17:00.Japanese: ヒトナナマルマル、提督、そろそろ日が暮れて来ました。
17:00.English: 1700, Admiral, it's almost time for the sunset.

18:00.Japanese: 現在時刻ヒトハチマルマルです。今日は半舷上陸にしちゃいます？
18:00.English: It is now 1800. Shall we let half the ship go ashore today?
18:00.Note: The ship's crew was divided into port and starboard, with alternating shore leave while docked.

19:00.Japanese: ヒトキュウマルマル。艦隊執務はここまでにして、お夕食にしましょう。
19:00.English: 1900. The fleet work has ended, let's have dinner.
19:00.Note: Non-combat ops in the IJN ended, as a rule, at 1800.

20:00.Japanese: フタマルマルマルです。ディナーはフルコースですよー、なんたって大和ホテルの…
20:00.English: 2000. Dinner is a full course~, after all, Hotel Yamato's...

21:00.Japanese: フタヒトマルマル。提督、大和の居住性、いかがでしょうか？
21:00.English: 2100. Admiral, why not partake of Yamato's livability?
21:00.Note: Even ratings on the Yamato got a personal locker on board; a rarity in the IJN.

22:00.Japanese: 現在時刻、フタフタマルマルです。そろそろお風呂タイムかな？
22:00.English: It is now 2200. Time for a bath, yes?

23:00.Japanese: 時刻はフタサンマルマルです。提督、本日も一日、本当にお疲れ様でした。
23:00.English: It is 2300. Admiral, today, as always, thank you for your hard work.

Hinamatsuri 2016.Japanese: 提督、ひな祭りですか？あら、かわいい、いいですね。武蔵？何を照れてるの？いいじゃない、ね？
Hinamatsuri 2016.English: Admiral, is it Hinamatsuri? Oh my, how cute, it's good, isn't? Musashi? Why are you embarrassed? It's good, right?

White Day 2016.Japanese: 提督！いいんですか、大和もいただいて？すみません。ありがとうございます。いただきますね。来年は頑張りますから！
White Day 2016.English: Admiral! Is is alright, for Yamato to take these? I'm sorry. Thank you very much. I humbly accept. I'll do my best next year!
White Day 2016.Note: Probably talking about their Hina dolls, while Musashi is embarrassed.

Spring 2016.Japanese: もうすぐ春…か。うふふっ。桜を見ると不思議な気持ちになるわ、不思議。え？これは、涙？なんで…？
Spring 2016.English: Spring is just around the corner, huh... Ufufu. Watching the cherry blossoms really gives me a mysterious feeling. Eh? These are... tears? Why...?

Third Anniversary 2016.Japanese: 提督、艦隊は三周年を迎えました。おめでとうございます。大和も、大和も嬉しいです！ラムネで、乾杯しましょう！
Third Anniversary 2016.English: Admiral, our fleet has reached its third year. Congratulations. I, Yamato... I am so happy for this occassion! Let's make a toast with some Ramune.
Third Anniversary 2016.Note: It seems she remembers Operation Ten-Go. She went to Okinawa in Apr 6, 1945. On the other side, it could be a hay fever.

Rainy Season 2016.Japanese: Iowaさん？ あ、かわいいですね、そのてるてる坊主。ねぇ、よかったら一緒に作りましょう。大和のはね、ここをこうして…。
Rainy Season 2016.English: Iowa-san? Ah, isn't that teru-teru bouzu cute? Say, would you like to make one together? For the ones I make, it goes like...

Mid-Summer 2016.Japanese: 提督、そんなに見ないでください！赤と白で少し派手だったかしら…そっ、そうですか？なら、よかったです。提督、ご一緒に。
Mid-Summer 2016.English: Admiral, don't stare that much! Red and white is a little flashy isn't it... I-is that so? Then, that's good. Admiral, together then.
